data.title: ParticleEditor: delta multiplier and simpler new emitters.
data.body:
Two minor enhancements/commits to the particle editor:
- Added a _delta multiplier_ to Editor Properties; scaling down the delta time is quite useful for timing multiple emitters and so forth. I didn't resize the Properties panel, felt that it would steal valuable space from the emitter panel.
- New emitters have a much more basic configuration, it became a little arduous resetting emitter properties every time a new one was added. The initial emitter remains the same as before though.

Let me know if anything needs revising, assuming it's worthy.

data.title: Fix for issue 1157
data.body:
just assigned the listener to the local variable to fix issue:

http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1157

data.title: Bullet, added some nested struct and raycast test
data.body:
- Implemented the nested structs in btCollisionWorld.
- Added RayCastTest showing the usage.
- Minor tweaks on the bullet tests.

data.title: Rename Slider#steps to Slider#stepSize
data.body:
Playing with the ScrollPaneTest I noticed the Slider didn't move smoothly. Perhaps the writer of that test assumed Slider#steps stands for the number of steps.

I've decreased the step size in ScrollPaneTest and renamed the variable in Slider to better convey its intent.

data.title: Fix for issue 1045 - LWP - app.destroy() / memory leaks
data.body:
Changed AndroidLiveWallpaper to not call graphics.destroy() on onDestroy() method to avoid the deadlock on AndroidGraphicsLiveWallpaper.destroy() which was waiting for graphics.OnDrawFrame() to be called and that was never called again since the surface was destroyed. Added also listener.dispose() before calling app.destryo() since nobody will call it otherwise (it was being called by graphics.onDrawFrame().

Probably not the best solution but I believe that is the real problem when calling app.destroy() which was causing problems.

The idea is to try to fix issue http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1132.

data.title: Fix for Issue 1147 - Set Live Wallpaper before preview loaded problem
data.body: Change the GLThread implementation with GLWallpaperService implementation.

data.title: Fix for Issue 1147 - Set Live Wallpaper before preview loaded problem
data.body: Change the GLThread implementation with GLWallpaperService implementation.

data.title: Fix for issue 1045 - LWP - app.destroy() / memory leaks
data.body:
Changed AndroidLiveWallpaper to not call graphics.destroy() on onDestroy() method to avoid the deadlock on AndroidGraphicsLiveWallpaper.destroy() which was waiting for graphics.OnDrawFrame() to be called and that was never called again since the surface was destroyed. Added also listener.dispose() before calling app.destryo() since nobody will call it otherwise (it was being called by graphics.onDrawFrame().

Probably not the best solution but I believe that is the real problem when calling app.destroy() which was causing problems.

The idea is to try to fix issue http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1132.

data.title: Fix for a bug when calling isPreview() inside the Engine constructor
data.body: It seems that isPreview() cant be called inside the Engine constructor since some stuff wasn't initialized yet. The pull request suggest another way by implementing an optional interface PreviewListener (not the best name I know) so if the listener implements it, then it is called by the Service after Engine was created.

data.title: Matrix4/Quaternion saving some cpu cycles on rotations
data.body:
1. Setting identity first on Matrix4.setToRotation/setFromEulerAngles is redundant because values are overwritten when setting from quaternion.
2. Some multiplications can be saved on Quaternion.setEulerAngles

data.title: Added setRotation methods to decal
data.body: Methods to set the rotation of a decal to the given angle.

data.title: Just added dispose() code to WaterRipples example
data.body: Added dispose() code to WaterRipples example to dispose the mesh, texture and batch (not) used.

data.title: Issue 1135: #isComplete and continuous particle emitters
data.body:
Issue [1135](http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1135): the check for emitter.isContinuous() in ParticleEffect#isComplete is not needed.

A continuous particle emitter will either return false for #isComplete() or return true when it has run to completion due to #allowCompletion.

I've added the ability to stop and continue particle effects in the ParticleEmitterTest to demonstrate this.

data.title: Simple typo fixed in Color Colour
data.body:
The link doesn't work because colour doesn't exist, however Color does.

I know they are both valid names for colour, however the existing @link doesn't work with Colour

data.title: Convenience methods for Dialog
data.body: I wanted to add ImageButtons and a Label with Align.center to the dialog. It's possible to do this by using #getContentTable() and #getButtonTable() but I suspect this is common enough to warrant an additional method.

data.title: Fixed bug that broke ScrollPane.setupFadeScrollBars
data.body: ScrollPane contains a small bug in its act method which effectively forces the fade delay and fade alpha to 1 second regardless of their intended values.

data.title: Added a removeAll method for all ArrayTypes
data.body:
Added a removeAll method to remove multiple items using another array of
the same type.

I cleaned it all up, so now it is all correct and in 1 commit.  Sorry about last night, I was tired and it had gotten messy.

I would like to start being active in helping with Libgdx and trying to start small with simple methods and adding comments/documentation and learning how this whole thing(libgdx and github) works. 

Thanks 
Adam :)

data.title: add removeAll method for all Array types
data.body:
Allows you to use a seperate Array to remove multiple items in the
array.

I wasn't sure how to add it, to my other pull request. So I made a new one.

data.title: Added a removeAll method
data.body:
Allows you to use a separate Array to remove multiple items in the array.

I was used to using a similar feature in ArrayList and wanted to see it here.

-Adam :)

data.title: Changed scene2d List to use BitmapFontCache
data.body: Just in idea to improve List draw time since it reuses already calculated BitmapFontCache instances instead of recalculating each time the text using font.draw(). It was only tested a bit so I suggest a double check before considering it for merging.

data.title: Max Length on TextField
data.body:
I found myself needing a max length restriction on the TextField, and the methods within the class that would need overridden are private or unavailable for overriding. 

This pull request adds native support for that max length. By default, it's set to zero, which means unlimited. To turn it on, just call setMaxLength() with some value > 0.

data.title: optionally check for modifications before packing
data.body:
I've added #isModified to TexturePacker2. This uses the modification timestamps to see if the pack file needs to be rebuild.
There are also two variants of #processIfModified for convenience.

For reference, checking the timestamps takes < 20ms while generating the pack file for my project takes up to 1600ms (in debug mode) or 1300ms (release build).

data.title: Fix for Issue 1109: TextField - Pasting Does Not Pass Through TextFieldFilter
data.body: Fix for issue 1109.

data.title: Make Game#setScreen accept null
data.body:
It starts out with screen == null, so it's silly that it's not possible to get back to that state.

Use case: I have a method that cleans up (disposes) a Screen without knowing which Screen will be next. Naturally, I don't want any references lying around to a disposed screen.

data.title: Implementation of Net API for some backends
data.body: I have started to implement the Net API for Android backend and want to start a discussion about what to use and what not to use, etc. Also, had to modify a bit the API to make it a bit similar to other implementations (for example http client, which most people using http should be familiar with) and to allow us to grow over it better if someone starts using it (like using parameter objects instead of several parameters, etc). Android and iOS implementations should be straightforward to implement since they have http client and .net http, dunno what to do for desktop yet.

data.title: apply latest changes (git #60cebee, #d916429) in Box2DDebugRenderer to t...
data.body:
The changes in pull request [103](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/103) should have been applied to the GWT backend as well.

Note: I don't have GWT running so I haven't tested it.

data.title: Fix touch events for LWP on Android API <9
data.body:
Without this fix HTC Hero with 2.2.1 does not respond touch events.
In removed "FIXME" commentstated about crash on ICS - i check it on the ICS 4.0.3 and all works, but anyway - i add SDK check. On the LG P990 with 2.3.5 no problems without SDK check. And workson the Samsung S5670 with 2.3.6. So, hope it's usefull.

data.title: getRotation for livewallpaper
data.body:
But it's little bit buggy, don't know why.
If you place your device to 0 degrees position (portraite orientation) 
and rotate to 180 degrees, nothing be detected, or from 90 to 270 and 
versa. But if you rotate your device from 0 to 90 or 270, or from 90 
to 180 and 0 and so on - all is fine (different orientations).

data.title: Changed BulletTest to BulletTestCollection, added colors, ConstraintsTest and MeshShapeTest
data.body:
Moved bullet to it's own test collection (like box2d). Switch to the next test by pressing space bar, menu button or a long press.

Added a simple constraints (joints) test.

Changed .gitignore so it doesn't shows the long list of compiled objs.

Added colors to better distinct object from each other.

Added MeshShapeTest. Please note that mesh shapes still need some additional nasty memory management.

data.title: Add support for generating signed distance fields
data.body:
The technique is described in this paper published by Valve:
http://www.valvesoftware.com/publications/2007/SIGGRAPH2007_AlphaTestedMagnification.pdf
- Add a generator for distance fields
- Add a main function to make it runnable as a command line program
- Add a filter to Hiero to create distance field fonts
- Add a test that demonstrates the usage of such fonts

See also this forum topic, which has screenshots:
http://badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=6022&p=28599
